key_points: Tiger Woods underwent emergency surgery after a rollover crash in Los Angeles.
Woods was the only person in the vehicle, which sustained "major damage".
He is recovering from surgery on his lower right leg and ankle, reportedly awake and responsive.
The crash occurred early Tuesday morning, and Woods had to be extracted from his vehicle by first responders.
Dr. Anish Mahajan reported Woods suffered significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity.
The crash is being treated as an accident, with no charges anticipated according to Sheriff Alex Villanueva.
Woods was wearing his seatbelt at the time, which Deputy Carlos Gonzalez said increased his survival chances.
The accident occurred in an area known for speeding and crashes, with 13 accidents there since last January.
Woods was in Los Angeles for his annual golf tournament and had been seen filming with celebrities prior to the crash.
This marks Woods' third automobile incident, with previous occurrences in 2009 and 2017.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (Chief Medical Officer and Interim CEO, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
Sheriff Alex Villanueva (Los Angeles County Sheriff)
Deputy Carlos Gonzalez (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)
